metadata.Title: CVE-2021-44420 on Ubuntu 22.04 ESM (jammy) - low.
metadata.Description:
In Django 2.2 before 2.2.25, 3.1 before 3.1.14, and 3.2 before 3.2.10, HTTP requests for URLs with trailing newlines could bypass upstream access control based on URL paths.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-44420` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

python3-django - 2:3.2.11-1
No subscription required

notes.Note: mdeslaur> code in bionic is different, doesn't look affected

criterions.comment: python-django package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2:3.2.11-1').
